official-title.#text:
To amend title VII of the Tariff Act of 1930 to clarify
		  that countervailing duties may be imposed to address subsidies relating to a
		  fundamentally undervalued currency of any foreign country.

cosponsor.#tail:

text.#text:
in
				the case in which the currency of a country in which the subject merchandise is
				produced is exchanged for foreign currency obtained from export transactions,
				and the currency of such country is a fundamentally undervalued currency, as
				defined in

quote.#text:
In the case of a subsidy relating to a fundamentally undervalued
			 currency, the fact that the subsidy may also be provided in circumstances not
			 involving export shall not, for that reason alone, mean that the subsidy cannot
			 be considered contingent upon export performance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:
